means: [地名] [美国] 保厄坦（波瓦坦）

sentence.Network_en: These new English settlers looked and acted very differently from Powhatan's tribe.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些新来的英国殖民在外观及行为上都不同于波瓦坦部落.

sentence.Network_en: Peace came when Pocahontas, daughter of chief Powhatan, married John Rolfe, a tobacco farmer in Jamestown.
sentence.Network_cn: 和平来自宝卡荷塔斯, 她是酋长包华德的女儿, 和詹姆斯敦一个烟草农夫,约翰罗夫结婚.

means.word_mean: 1. Indian chief and founder of the Powhatan confederacy of tribes in eastern Virginia; father of Pocahontas (1550?-1618)
2. a member of the Algonquian people who formerly lived in eastern Virginia
3. the Algonquian language of the Powhatan people

auth_sentence.content: Her father was leader of a tribe, the Powhatan.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her father was leader of a tribe, the Powhatan.

auth_sentence.content: His real name was Wahunsonacock, but he was known to the colonists as Powhatan.
